page.title: 01LLANBISTER GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: A beautiful area of rounded hills varying in height between 900 and 1400 feet, with trees and hedges giving a park like appearence. The river Ithon meanders with the A483 following its course. Nearly all farmland or common except for the small village of Llanbister. Wild flowers and birds in plenty. Some 54 men, 47 women and 22 children live in the area, mainly native Welsh but essentially English speaking. Main occupation farming but many trades. Sports Day is the main event of the year with whist drives in the winter. The village shop and church hall are the social centres. There are three churches. The "Radnor" friendliness pervades and fund raising is easy.The community spirit is very strong. There is a primary school.
